intro: Echinopsis tucumanensis, commonly known as the Tucumán cactus, is a species of cactus native to Argentina. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems covered in white, woolly spines. The plant produces striking, night-blooming flowers that are typically pale yellow or pink. It thrives in arid environments and requires minimal water, making it well adapted to desert conditions. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in rock gardens.
